meanings.sent1: I read the gazettes every morning to catch up on the news.
meanings.sent2: The gazettes in our town cover local events and stories.
meanings.sent3: The gazettes were so old, the ink had faded to a pale yellow.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a gazette of memories, each page filled with moments from the past.
meanings.sent5: The gazettes fluttered in the wind, their pages rustling like autumn leaves.

meanings.definition: To announce or publish in a gazette
meanings.sent1: The mayor gazettes important announcements for the town.
meanings.sent2: They gazette the new laws in the official government publication.
meanings.sent3: He gazettes his daily schedule on the bulletin board for everyone to see.
meanings.sent4: The news of their engagement was gazetted in the local paper.
meanings.sent5: She gazettes her thoughts on life in her personal blog, sharing them with the world.
